alert.note: Alert for Lower Rio Grande Valley; San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 4:29PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL SOCORRO COUNTY THROUGH 500 PM MDT... At 429 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near San Antonio, or near Socorro, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Socorro, San Antonio, Laborcita, and Luis Lopez. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 134 and 149. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 129 and 138. Highway 380 between Mile Markers 1 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.

area.areaDesc: Lower Rio Grande Valley; San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands
